title: Emergency Contacts
content:
Police: 100

Fire: 101

Ambulance: 102

Disaster Helpline: 108

National Emergency: 112

Local Hospital: 123-456-7890

title: Earthquake Safety
content:
- Drop, Cover, Hold On

- Stay indoors until shaking stops

- Evacuate after shaking

- Stay away from windows and heavy furniture

- If outside, move to open ground away from buildings

title: Flood Precautions
content:
- Move valuables to higher ground

- Switch off electricity

- Evacuate if instructed

- Avoid walking/driving through flood water



- Keep emergency kit and clean water ready

title: Evacuation Plan
content:
- Exit through main gate

- Assemble at safe zone

- Wait for further instructions

- Carry essential documents

- Assist elderly and children during evacuation

title: Fire Safety
content:
- Call Fire Department immediately (101)

- Use stairs, not elevators

- If smoke, crawl low under it

- Stop, Drop, and Roll if clothes catch fire

- Keep a fire extinguisher accessible

title: First Aid Basics
content:
- Control bleeding with clean cloth

- Check breathing and pulse

- Perform CPR if necessary

- Keep first aid kit at home

- Do not give food/water to unconscious person

title: Cyclone Precautions
content:
- Stay indoors, away from windows

- Secure loose objects outside

- Store food and drinking water

- Listen to radio/TV for alerts

- Evacuate if authorities advise

title: Heatwave Safety
content:
- Stay hydrated, drink water frequently

- Avoid going out during peak sun

- Wear light-colored, loose clothing

- Use fans, cool cloth, or shade

- Watch for signs of heatstroke

title: Emergency Kit
content:
- Water bottles (3 days supply)

- Non-perishable food

- Flashlight and batteries

- First aid kit

- Important documents

- Mobile charger and power bank

- Whistle to signal for help

title: Important Reminders
content:
- Stay calm in all situations

- Always follow official instructions

- Help neighbors if possible

- Keep family emergency contacts handy

- Review evacuation plan monthly
